TODAY AND TOMORROW TAIWANESE RESIDENTS WHO CONTRIBUTE OVER $30 WILL RECEIVE ONE VIP TICKET TO THE SEPTEMBER SHOW. BUT HURRY, THERE IS ONLY 10 ON OFFER!æœ€å¾Œå…©å¤©ï¼å°ç£çš„è§€çœ¾ç«™å‡ºä¾†ï¼ææ¬¾è¶…éŽ30ç¾Žé‡‘å°‡å¾—åˆ°å…è²»çš„æˆ²ç¥¨ä¸€å¼µï¼é™é‡åå¼µï¼è¦æ¶è¦å¿«ï¼ 
We are: A collective of International Artists developing a visually provocative theatre work that merges linguistic and cultural borders.  Drawing on our personal, cultural and linguistic histories we will together discover the universal tale surrounding the themes of love, desire and beauty based on the new play, Bird Song, by Ren Flannery.  This is the debut of Bird Song and through a two and half month creative exchange taking place in Taipei we will draw on our diverse artistic practices to create a work that communicates to a global audience and transcends cultural, linguistic and social divide.  Without your help Bird Song may never see the light of day and the boundaries of theatrical story telling may never be explored!!  Help us fly....
æˆ‘å€‘æ˜¯ä¸€ç¾¤ä¾†è‡ªä¸–ç•Œå„åœ°çš„è—è¡“å·¥ä½œè€…ï¼Œæƒ³è¦å‘ˆç¾ä¸€é½£è·¨æ–‡åŒ–ï¼Œè¶…è¶Šèªžè¨€è—©ç±¬ï¼Œç”±å‰µä½œè€…è‡ªèº«å‡ºç™¼ï¼ŒæŽ¢è¨Žäººæ€§è£¡å…±æœ‰çš„æ„›æƒ…ã€æ¬²æœ›èˆ‡ç¾Žæ„Ÿçš„ä½œå“ã€‚é€™é½£æˆ²å°‡æœƒæœ‰å…©å€‹åŠæœˆçš„å·¥ä½œæœŸï¼Œå‰µä½œç™¼æƒ³ç‚ºæ¾³æ´²å¥³å°Žæ¼”æ©èŠ®(RenFlannery)æ‰€å¯«çš„æ–‡æœ¬<é³¥ä¹‹é Œ> (Bird’s Song)ï¼Œæˆ‘å€‘å°‡åˆ©ç”¨æˆ‘å€‘å¤šæ¨£çš„è—è¡“æ‰‹æ³•èˆ‡å‰µæ„ï¼Œåœ¨å°åŒ—ç™¼è¡¨æ¼”å‡ºï¼Œç¶“ç”±ä¸åŒæ–‡åŒ–èƒŒæ™¯çš„å‰µä½œè€…å…±åŒäº¤æµï¼Œæˆ‘å€‘çš„ä½œå“å°‡æœƒè‡´åŠ›æ–¼è¶…è¶Šæ–‡åŒ–ï¼Œèªžè¨€å’Œç¤¾æœƒé´»æºï¼Œå‚³é”å‡ºæ™®ä¸–æƒ…æ„Ÿèˆ‡èªžè¨€ä¹‹å¤–çš„åº•è˜Šã€‚
Qui sommes-nous ?Nous sommes un collectif d’artistes internationaux qui travaillons au développementd’un théâtre visuellement provocateur combinant différents horizons linguistiques etculturels. Puisant dans les récits de nos cultures respectives, nous nous lançons à ladécouverte d’un conte universel bâti autour des thèmes de l’amour, du désir et de labeauté, basé sur la nouvelle pièce de Ren Flannery, Bird Song. Nous nous sommesposé à Taipei (Taiwan) où, pendant deux mois et demi de gestation et d’échangesartistiques, nous allons élaborer une œuvre qui a pour vocation de dépasser lesclivages culturels, linguistiques et sociaux, et de s’adresser au monde entier.
What we need: We desperately need a Taiwanese local with profecient English skills to act as a full time production manager/translator/administrator.  They will be the much-needed oil in the machine, bridging all language and cultural confusion that comes with working on foreign soil.  As this is a rare independant project working across different cultures we face many complexities most theatre shows wouldn't and we depseratley need a savvy local to help us achieve vital communications with the Taiwanese Government, immigration, the Theatre, the ticketing system, the insurance company, the local sponsors, various marketing platforms and the Taipei community. 
As this position will be the key to our success we need to ensure the appointed person has the ability to dedicate all of their time to this project, as it is quite a demanding role.  Living expenses are high in Taipei but wages are low so that most unmarried people have to live at home with their parents their entire lives.  The money raised here will pay the wage of this person allowing them to fullfill the role accordingly.  It will also cover the flights and accommodation of our overseas artists and the translation of the script and other important documents.
The entire budget of the project is roughly $50,000USD; with $10,000USD confirmed we can adequately begin this journey.  By supporting our project you will be actively participating in the beginning of an innovative exploration into communication across racial divide through the celebration of Art and humanity.  With your contribution you will be joining our ecclectic team in creating a visually provacative, visceral and profound new theatre work that will touch audiences world wide.

De quoi avons-nous besoin ?Mon nom est Ren Flannery. Je suis une artiste indépendante et je suis arrivée à Taipei avec uneconnaissance basique du chinois mandarin et une valise pleine à craquée de grandesidées. J’ai reçu jusqu’à présent un soutien et des retours extraordinaires. Aussi, aprèsquatre mois de dur labeur et un nombre incalculable de discussions, le projet est enbel et bien en marche ! Je porte aujourd’hui entre autres les différentes casquettesd’écrivain, metteuse en scène, productrice, administratrice et chargée de promotion.Dans un tel contexte, et alors que le financement de la production me paraît extrêmentprometteur, ce dont nous avons vraiment besoin maintenant, c’est de pouvoiremployer à plein temps une personne locale et de lui confier les missions de directeur/directrice de production, de traducteur/traductrice-interpête et d’administrateur/administratrice. Vu le caractère extrêmement chronophage des difficultés rencontréesjusqu’ici dans l’avancement des questions de logistique du spectacle, il va sans direque cette personne jouera un rôle d’une importance capitale dans la suite du projet.Il s’agira pour elle de me servir d’intermédiaire auprès du Gouvernement Taiwanais,du Théâtre, du système de vente de billets en ligne, de la compagnie d’assurance, dessponsors locaux, des différentes plateformes de marketing et de la communauté de laville de Taipei. Ce poste étant la clé de notre réussite, nous devons nous assurer quela personne qui endosse cette lourde reponsabilité ait la capacité d’y consacrer toutson temps. L’argent que nous allons récolter ici servira à payer cette personne, lesbillets d’avion et le logement de nos artistes étrangers et la traduction du scénario. Lebudget total de la production étant de plus ou moins 50 000 dollars, il est raisonnabled’estimer qu’avec 10 000 dollars fermes, nous pouvons d’ores et déjà entamer levoyage en toute sérénité. En apportant votre soutien à notre projet, vous choisissezde prendre vous aussi activement part au lancement d’une exploration innovante dela communication et du dialogue interculturels, à travers la célébration de l’art et del’humanité !
The Plan:  Bird Song will be developed through a two and half month creative exchange with a team of International Artists in Taipei City, where it will debut at Guling Street Avant-Garde Theatre in mid-September.  Once the production is up the next step is to tour it around the Asia/Pacific first and then Europe and the USA in 2013/2014.  Bird Songhas been intentionally developed to tour with the ability to adapt to changing audience and performance environments making it accessible to a broad spectrum of audiences, festivals and programs.
<é³¥ä¹‹é Œ>è¨ˆç•«æ­¤<é³¥ä¹‹é Œ>è¨ˆç•«ç‚ºæœŸå…©å€‹åŠæœˆï¼Œåœ¨å°åŒ—å¸‚é€²è¡Œåœ‹éš›è—è¡“åœ˜éšŠçš„å‰µæ„äº¤æµï¼Œæˆæžœå°‡æ–¼ä¹æœˆä¸­æ–¼ç‰¯å¶ºè¡—å°åŠ‡å ´å‘ˆç¾ã€‚åœ¨å°åŒ—é¦–æ¼”å¾Œï¼Œæ›´ç±Œå‚™åœ¨2013~14å¹´å…§å…ˆæ–¼äºžæ´²å€åŸŸå·¡è¿´æ¼”å‡ºï¼Œç¹¼è€Œå‰å¾€æ­ç¾Žç­‰åœ°ã€‚æ­¤ä½œå“ä»¥åœ‹éš›å·¡æ¼”ç‚ºç›®æ¨™é€²è¡Œå‰µæ„ç™¼æƒ³ï¼Œæ¼”å‡ºå…§å®¹å¯é€éŽèˆ‡åœ¨åœ°æ–‡åŒ–çš„æ”¹ç·¨ï¼Œå› æ‡‰ä¸åŒå·¡æ¼”å€åŸŸçš„æ–‡åŒ–èƒŒæ™¯ã€‚
C’est quoi le plan ?Bird Song sera développée dans la ville de Taipei (Taiwan), pendant deux moiset demi d’échanges créatifs entre les membres d’une équipe composée d’artistesinternationaux et créée au Théâtre Avant-Garde de la rue Guling, mi-septembre 2012.Une fois la production sur pied, nous entamerons une tournée en Asie-Pacifique dansun premier temps, puis en Europe et aux Etats-Unis pour la saison 2013-2014. BirdSong a été spécialement conçue pour pouvoir faire le tour du monde, et s’adaptefacilement à des publics et à des conditions de représentation variées, ce qui la rendaccessible à un large éventail de publics, de festivals et de programmations.
Bird Song is: a fantastical tale that traverses time and explores the universal themes of love, desire and beauty found within the intimate moments of self. Seeking the common voice of the feminine sensuality, Bird Song uses shadow and light, dream and song to narrate the quiet journey of two women and a mythological bird each entrapped in a world that dictates their fate.  Bird Song uses visual and performance mechanisms to explore the core essentials of humanity and the intimate moments that bind us as a singular race.
Situated in a private bathhouse Bird Song follows the journeys of two women from different worlds.  The lives of a Japanese aristocrats daughter from the late Qing dynasty and a well educated maid from the cultural revolution begin to intertwine through their relationship with a beautiful mythological Bird based on Chinese mythological pre-human woman who discovered theatre. Their discovery of love, desire and beauty comes from the most intimate moments with self as they go about their daily rituals.  The intersection of their lives no longer allows them to live within their naive pasts as they discover the most beautiful and tragic realities of their hearts. 
é—œæ–¼<é³¥ä¹‹é Œ><é³¥ä¹‹é Œ>æ˜¯ä¸€éƒ¨è·¨è¶Šæ™‚é–“è—©ç±¬çš„å¥‡å¹»æ•…äº‹ï¼Œå®ƒæŽ¢ç´¢äº†äººå€‘åœ¨è‡ªæˆ‘çš„ç§å¯†æ™‚åˆ»è£¡ï¼Œç¸½æœƒé¢å°åˆ°çš„é—œæ–¼æ„›ã€æ¬²æœ›ã€ç¾Žè²Œç­‰èˆ‰ä¸–çš†ç„¶çš„è­°é¡Œã€‚é€™éƒ¨æˆ²è©¦åœ–å°‹æ‰¾å‡ºå¥³æ€§æ„Ÿå®˜çš„å…±åŒè²éŸ³ï¼Œä¸¦åˆ©ç”¨å…‰ã€å½±ã€å¤¢ã€æ­Œæ›²ä¾†æè¿°å…©ä½å¥³å­åŠä¸€éš»è™›æ§‹çš„é³¥çš„æ²‰éœæ—…ç¨‹ï¼Œè€Œé€™ä¸‰å€‹è§’è‰²éƒ½è¢«å›¿æ–¼ä¸€å€‹å‘½é‹ä¸ç”±å·±çš„ä¸–ç•Œè£¡ã€‚ã€ˆé³¥ä¹‹é Œã€‰é€éŽè¦–è¦ºç‰¹æ•ˆå’Œè¡¨æ¼”æ‰‹æ³•æŽ¢ç´¢äººæ€§çš„æ ¸å¿ƒæœ¬è³ªï¼Œä»¥åŠé‚£äº›å°‡äººå€‘çµåˆç‚ºä¸€å€‹ç¾¤é«”çš„ç§å¯†æ™‚åˆ»ã€‚
A propos de Bird SongBird Song est un conte fantastique qui traverse plusieurs époques et explore lesthèmes universels de l’amour, du désir et de la beauté, tels qu’on peut les vivre dansles moments d’intimité avec soi-même. Cherchant la voix de la sensualité féminine,Bird Song exploite les jeux d’ombres et de lumières, le rêve et la chanson pourraconter le paisible voyage de deux femmes et d’un oiseau mythologique, tous troispris au piège dans un monde qui conditionne leur destinée. Bird Song utilise le visuelet les mécanismes du jeu d’acteur pour explorer ce noyau essentiel d’humanité, cesmoments d’intimité qui nous relient les uns aux autres en une seule et unique race.
How it began: Witnessing a break down of understanding between various cultural communities in Australia impassioned Ren Flannery to find the points where human beings connect as a singular race.  Three years ago, while riding a train on cold, grey Melbourne day she had a vision of a warmly lit bathhouse with a gilded birdcage by the window.  This image sparked the writing of her new work Bird Song, which explores the notions of love, desire and beauty from an internal source opposed to the external perspective of ‘what is?’  Bird Song was written with the intention of touring it across the globe and reaching audience beyond the typical 'theatre going' demographic.  By using a collaborative development process Bird Song will act as a platform for exploring theatrical story telling to a universal audience, connecting a linguistically and culturally diverse audience in a shared experience.
é€™ä¸€åˆ‡æ˜¯å¦‚ä½•é–‹å§‹çš„?è¦ªèº«ç¶“æ­·ã€è¦ªçœ¼ç›®ç¹ç”±å¤šå…ƒæ—ç¾¤æ§‹æˆçš„æ¾³æ´²ç¤¾æœƒè£¡ï¼Œæ–‡åŒ–é´»æºæ˜¯å¦‚ä½•é€ æˆå½¼æ­¤çš„èª¤è§£ã€èªžæ„çš„ç„¡æ•ˆï¼Œæ¾³ç±å°Žæ¼”Ren Flannery èŒç™¼ä¸€ç¨®å¥‡ç‰¹çš„æƒ³æ³•ï¼šèƒ½ä¸èƒ½å°‡æ‰€æœ‰äººé¡žè¦–ç‚ºåŒä¸€ç¨®å–®ä¸€çš„æ—ç¾¤ï¼Œæœ‰ä¸€å€‹å½¼æ­¤ç›¸äº’é€£çµã€ç›¸è­˜ç„¡ç¤™çš„é»žã€‚é€™å€‹æƒ³æ³•ç”¢ç”Ÿä»¥å¾Œåˆç¶“éŽäº†ä¸‰å¹´ï¼Œåœ¨æŸå€‹ç°æš—æ¿•å†·ã€æ¯«ç„¡å…‰ç·šçš„å¢¨çˆ¾æœ¬å¤œæ™šï¼Œååœ¨ç«è»Šçª—é‚Šæ—…è¡Œä¸­çš„å°Žæ¼”è…¦æµ·ä¸­çªç„¶ç”¢ç”Ÿäº†ä¸€å€‹ç•«é¢ï¼šä¸€é–“æº«æš–ã€ç†±çƒ˜çƒ˜çš„æ¾¡å ‚ï¼Œèˆ‡ä¸€å€‹éé‡‘ã€å®‰ç½®åœ¨çª—æ—çš„é³¥ç± ã€‚é€™å€‹æ„è±¡é–‹å•Ÿäº†æ–°ä½œå“<é³¥ä¹‹æ­Œ>çš„éˆæ„Ÿï¼Œé‡æ–°æŽ¢è¨Žæ„›æƒ…ã€æ¬²æœ›ä»¥åŠç¾Žè²Œçš„æ¦‚å¿µï¼Œå¾žå…§åœ¨éœ€è¦èˆ‡å¤–åœ¨ä¸–ç•Œå°é€™äº›”åè©ž”çš„æƒ³åƒä¹‹é–“æ‰¾å°‹æœ€åŽŸåˆçš„æƒ…æ„Ÿã€‚<é³¥ä¹‹é Œ>æœ€æ—©çš„å‰µä½œç†å¿µè£¡å³åŒ…å«äº†ã€Œè¦å°‡é€™å€‹ä½œå“å¸¶åˆ°å…¨ä¸–ç•Œã€ï¼Œä»¥åŠå¸¶é ˜ä¸å¸¸çœ‹æˆ²çš„è§€çœ¾èµ°é€²åŠ‡å ´ï¼Œæƒ³è¶…è¶Šä»¥å¾€çš„è§€æˆ²æ—ç¾¤ã€‚ é€šéŽå”åŠ›äº¤æµã€ä¸ŸæŽ¥æƒ³æ³•çš„éŽç¨‹ï¼Œ<é³¥ä¹‹é Œ>å°‡ä½œç‚ºä¸€å€‹æŽ¢ç´¢æˆ²åŠ‡å¦‚ä½•èªªæ•…äº‹ã€è¬›è¿°åŒæ¨£æ•…äº‹çµ¦ä¸åŒæ–‡åŒ–èƒŒæ™¯ä¸‹çš„è§€çœ¾ç¾¤ï¼Œé€£æŽ¥èªžè¨€ä¸åŒçš„è§€çœ¾å…±äº«ç¶“é©—çš„å¹³å°ã€‚
Comment cela a-t-il commencé ?Constatant l’existence de véritables fossés de communication entre les différentescommunautés culturelles australiennes, Ren Flannery s’est mise en quête desuniversaux encore capables de connecter entre eux tous les êtres humains. Il y a troisans, perdue dans la contemplation d’un Melbourne gris et froid qu’elle traversait entrain, elle eut la vision d’une maison de bain baignée d’une lumière chaude et d’unecage à oiseau dorée à la fenêtre. C’est cette image qui est à l’origine de l’écriturede sa nouvelle œuvre Bird Song, qui explore de l’intérieur les notions d’amour, dedésir et de beauté plutôt que de s’interroger sur la nature de ces concepts. Bird Songa été écrite avec le projet de montrer cette pièce au monde entier et de toucher unpublic plus large que celui qui se rend généralement au théâtre. Envisagé commeun processus de développement collaboratif, Bird Song se veut un laboratoire oùexplorer l’art de la narration théâtrale, et ce, dans une perspective universelle visantà connecter liguistiquement et culturellement différents publics réunis autour d’uneexpérience commune.
Just some of the talented team that is growing daily! Writer/Director: Ren Flannery (Australian) www.renflannery.com Composer/sound designer: Thomas Foguenne (Belgian) www.thomasfoguenne.com Visual Designer: Don Salubayba (Filipino) http://anino.sining.net/ Performers: Tzu-Han Chi (Taiwanese)

story:
sExtOrtiOn (C) 2012 ptmc

I'm back at it again.... after exceeding my fund raising goals last summer for PRIDE RIVER CROSSING and winning Awards for Best Playwright & Best Ensemble Acting at the All Out Arts Fresh Fruit Festival, I now have the teen sexting dramedy, sExtOrtiOn, to bring to Festival July 8th through July 14th, 2013 at The Wild Project on NYC's lower east side.

sExtOrtiOn is a fictional account of actual events regarding a teen sexting scandal that shook a community and made national news. The term sExtOrtiOn was coined by the media for the particular combination of teen texting/sexting and subsequent extortion. Our story deals with a boy who poses as a girl on a social media site to get others to send him compromising photos & videos, and "sextorts" them into upping the ante with each contact with the threat of exposure.  This "sextortion" took place for over a year before anyone outside the boy's circle knew of it, and the subsequent exposure of the situation had everyone wondering how it could have ever taken place.

In sExtOrtiOn, 6 boys, 2 girls & 1 adult, take the audience on a harrowing cyber ride into the world of teen sexting.  Comedy & drama cover the bases of... sexual identity, texting/sexting, bullying, pack behaviors, teen recklessness, adult/child relationships and coping mechanisms.

"We all cope in different ways", says one character, and I cope by putting the story into the mouths of 9 actors to tell the tale.  Help me & those 9 actors & the creative team tell the tale of Donny Doirko sentenced as an adult for what he did as a minor now spending an inordinate number of years incarcerated. 

Without you, this tale will remain between the covers of a report binder and not see the light of day. With you, a light can shine on problems of injustice in our court systems and day to day terrors teens face in just walking into school.

Help me focus that light, and help sExtortiOn find the light of day.......

And, all contributions are tax deductible through the umbrella of CAN'T SLEEP INC's 501c3 for creating new work, with your Pay Pal connected donation. 

And, if you can't "cope" financially right now, please help us get the word out and make some noise about our Indiegogo campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you for your continuing or original support .....

Patrick Thomas McCarthy  pTmC

 

sExtOrtiOn by pTmC [C] 2012  

Director/Designer: Christopher Caines

Fight Director: Galway McCullough

Production Stage Manager: Veronica Gheller

Media Designer: Katherine Hammond, Warehouse of Theatre, Old Dominion University, Norfolk, VA

Costume Coordinator: Susan Cook

Playwright/Producer: Patrick Thomas McCarthy  

 

Cast of Characters:

Quin Quimby.... Joshua Warr

Donny Doirko... Spencer Scott

Buck Cummings .... Seth Shirley

Ben Benjamin.....  Andrew Gelles

Brent Dodge....  Joshua David Bishop

Bradley Michael White, the BMW .... Justin Garascia

Brenda Fenton Flair, the BFF ..... Julia Hochner 

Britany Gray ..... Chantal Thomson

Mr. Zee .... Jeff Ronan

 

Performance Dates:

at The Wild Project [195 East 3rd St at Ave B near Houston St]

Mon July 8 at 7pm

Tues July 9 at 9pm

Sun July 14 at 2pm

TICKETS:  $18    
Go to.... 
http://www.freshfruitfestival.com/purchase-festival-tickets/ 
click on PURCHASE TICKETS to go to
https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/cal/527
 

 

sExToRtiOn

 

© 2012  Reg# PAu 3-623-286 by Patrick Thomas McCarthy pTmC

Patrickmcc2449@hotmail.com PtMcplaywriting.com

All characters and situations are fictional

Characters

The Boys: [in their 20’s to play teens]

Donny Doirko: DD, small, dark, a troubled loner

Buck Cummings: BC, jock, control issues

Bennett Benjamin: BB, jock, tallest & biggest of the boys, object of desire

Bradley Michael White: the BMW, golden boy athlete, promised to Brenda

Brent Dodge: BD, average teen, marching band geek, Britany’s boyfriend

Quin Quimby: QQ, out gay male teen

The Girls:  [in their 20’s to play teens]

Brenda Fenton Flair: BFF, cheerleader, promised to Brad

Britany Gray: BG, cool girl, office monitor, Brent’s girlfriend

The Adult: 

Mr. Zee: the administrator, also voices Quin’s offstage dad
 
TO PURCHASE $18 Tickets to sExtOrtiOn go to...
http://www.freshfruitfestival.com/purchase-festival-tickets/  
then click on PURCHASE TICKETS to take you to .....
https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/cal/527

story:
ARTISTIC STATEMENT 

PLAYWRIGHT/CO-TRANSLATOR & ACTRESS SAMANTHA GRASSIAN:

"I am a firm believer in the fact that instead of torturing their audience with existential questions such as why human beings are on this planet, or why we feel what we feel, playwrights, directors, and actors should focus on making their audiences happy. Theater is a wonderful vehicle for laughter and pain relief, and I believe that people go through enough pain in their lives to be forced to watch more pain when they go to the theater. As artists, it is our duty to make people laugh, to make them happy: because happy people make a better world."

WHAT'S THE STORY?

The play “The Goldfish” is a dark comedy, which was originally written in French, with the title “Le Poisson Rouge”. “The Goldfish” will be performed in both French and English, depending on the evening you attend; thus allowing the audience to pick and choose in which language they would prefer to see it. The play also mixes three artistic disciplines: theater, mime and dance. This situation comedy in which two completely clueless blondes deal with a dead body on stage makes this work an inventive, comical, and an out of the ordinary piece.

Therefore, take two blondes, a dead man walking and dancing, a goldfish found ‘belly up’, and you will end up with a recipe for disaster.

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET:

This is an ambitious and unique cultural event for the city of New York that will take significant resources to produce. We would love for you to become a part of this theatrical experience by supporting our immensely talented group of performers who will take the stage to perform in 2 languages across many evenings, our lighting designer who will be dealing with the intricacies of how light works in the world of the play in both of our performance spaces this fall, and our creative & marketing team who will be getting the word out about the show!

We seek your generous support to help with the following:

  • Cost of renting rehearsal space and covering festival participation fees
  • Covering the $2500/week theatre rental plus insurance costs
  • Covering equipment insurance premiums and rental of technical equipment
  • Publicity and expanding outreach to the global community
  • Materials to realize ambitious costumes, lighting, and video design
  • Creating live-able stipends for our creative artists 

The 4th Street Theatre at 83 E. 4th Street, East Village, NYC. We have the rental contract signed!

HOW TO MAKE AN IMPACT:

We need one FINAL PUSH to make this project happen so we can successfully open the show at Theater for the New City's DREAM UP FESTIVAL from September 1st-8th (all performances in English) followed by a week-long run presented by Lauren Rayner Productions {LRP} at the 4th Street Theatre from October 1st-6th (2 performances a night, alternating English and French).

Our current goal is to raise $5,000 by the time we open the show in September. Please give whatever you can, anything and everything will help us on this journey!

Since this a not-for-profit production and our producer, Lauren Rayner Productions, is a fiscally sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, your contribution will be tax-deductible. Check out all of the perks to see how you can be involved and even get a sneak-peek of the show in our trailer!

MAKE SOME NOISE!

Just because you may not be able to contribute doesn’t mean you lose your chance to help make this project happen!

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to make it super easy (top of the page!)
  • Tell people how much you want to see this show come to New York and pass this onto your fancy friends with deep pockets.
  • "Like" The Goldfish / "Le Poisson Rouge" on Facebook!

WHO'S ON THE TEAM?

Directed by Roxane Revon
Written by Samantha Grassian
Produced by Lauren Rayner

Featuring Nathalie Bryant, Samantha Grassian, and Zilong Pu

Assistant Directed by Sara Jecko

Choreography by Zilong Pu
Music by Florent Canepa
Translated by Samantha Grassian and Celine Texier-Rose

Photography by Amanda Lima

story:
Please if you can donate as little as £1 or $1 this makes us 1 step closer to our goal.

A Little bit about us. 

Royston Amateur Performing Arts Group (RAPAG) is a non-profit group run by volunteers to get children and adults from low socioeconomic backgrounds to enjoy and embrace theatre and at the same time providing the community with affordable theatre that all can participate in or enjoy watching. We do 2 shows a year, a summer show and then a December show, and the children love it.

We are currently campaigning so that we can buy extra stage units that can be extended with our original stage.

This will enable our group to expand. We currently only allow up to 20 people in our theatre group this is because our stage is so tiny. 

We constantly have to say no to new members wanting to join us, the reason being our stage is too small to accommodate more than 20 people. 

With this staging unit that we are campaigning for we will be able open up our membership allowing more children & adults to join in with our fun on stage.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise £2440 in total - this is the total cost of the above stage and is inclusive of UK's VAT. You can see the stage in more detail here

We have some great perks to say thank you for your donation. Take a look on the right.

Why we need this?

We have been established for more than 10 years and have provided fun, laughter and entertainment as well as being able to build social confidence for kids on and off the stage. 

We want to reach out to more people. I hope you can help. 

Thank You. 

RAPAG

Facebook

story:
Hey Hey!

First of all, thanks for checking this out! It takes passion, determination, inspiration, and lots of money, to create amazing theatre. We have three of these in abundance… can you help us with the fourth?

 

We are a new company called Beside the Salt Productions and here is some information about our mandate and us:

Beside the Salt Productions is an Edmonton based company geared towards generating the presentation of theatre, dance and multimedia. Beside the Salt is committed to bringing together both experienced and emerging artists to work together and share a wealth of traditions, skills, ideas and inspirations. Beside the Salt chooses to explore varied artistic approaches, alternative spaces and styles that challenge the boundaries between artists and audiences.

Beside the Salt chooses to endeavor an approach to the pieces that we bring to the community by incorporating a variety of cultural, historical, and stylistic elements to our work. Taking inspiration from traditions, dances, and lifestyles of different regions, along with incorporating technology that assists in the production of a piece. Beside the Salt also tries to find unique and appropriate places to house our presentations. From current theatre spaces, to warehouses, or lounges our goal is to locate venues that are not only suitable from an artistic standpoint but that are also applicable to the pieces we are producing.

With a strong focus on the significance of text and movement, Beside the Salt highlights the importance of further developing an artist’s tools. As speakers, singers, dancers and movers Beside the Salt aims to allow the artists we work with to develop a more acute grasp of their own style and creative process while still maintaining the momentum of the group and its current projects.

Beside the Salt Productions takes precaution that what it produces will reach as broad an audience as possible; while at the same time, takes great care to ensure we maintain a strong, relevant, attentive, responsive and sensitive stance in our company’s work.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This summer Beside the Salt is producing a BRAND NEW WORK called “dust.” at the Edmonton International Fringe Festival. We have been so lucky thus far and some incredible people have helped us out a long the way. We just need a little more help to take us all the way. Your donation will help us with things like: photography, handbills, posters and programs. As well as exciting things like a set and an ORIGINAL SCORE to accompany the show!!

Aside from the perks you see to the right, everyone who donates to this campaign will receive a special thank-you in our show program. Your support and the support of our community are what make independent theatre possible. So thank you. Whether you donate $1 or $100 thank you for your contribution. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us out financially, we understand! Please help us to spread the word about our campaign!

 

 

THANKS AGAIN!!

story:
WE NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE THE EUROPEAN PREMIERE OF RAPPORT AND NEW CREATION BY TOMI PAASONEN POSSIBLE.

Directed by Yannis Adoniou, KUNST-STOFF is a San Francisco based, Goldie award winning contemporary dance company that has been creating eclectic movement-focused art experiences in the Bay Area for the past 15 years. This summer, the company has been invited to bring their latest creation Rapport to Berlin. In addition, the KUNST-STOFF artists will have the opportunity to begin a new work with Berlin based choreographer Tomi Paasonen who co-founded the company with Yannis Adoniou in 1998. This new work will commemorate the company's 15th anniversary season and will premiere at ODC Theater this fall. This IndioGOGO campaign for $7,000 will go directly to support our flights and artistic fees.

Merging text and movement, Rapport exposes four artists as they dive beyond their performative lives. The European premiere at DOCK 11 will feature KUNST-STOFF Contributing Artists Yannis Adoniou, Katie Gaydos, Calvin Hilpert, and Lindsey Renee Derry.  Please take a moment to read about them below.

For twelve years now the KUNST-STOFF Dance Company has built a strong relationship with Dock 11, the premier venue for experimental performance in Berlin. Through this relationship we have built a creative bridge that now allows Bay Area artists to be exposed in Berlin. This year we are expanding our programming to include two packed weeks of workshops, residencies, and performances. While Dock 11 will support the majority of our theater production and promotion costs, we are required to find support for our travel expenses and artistic stipends during the tour.

Tomi Paasonen- choreographer, director and multimedia artist, based in Berlin and born in Helsinki, Finland- shares his time making pieces for KUNST-STOFF and directing stage art, creating choreographic structures, making video installations, interactive works, photography and teaching dance in Europe where he operates under the name PAA (Public Artistic Affairs). It has been several years since Tomi has been able to create a new group work for KUNST-STOFF, making this upcoming residency even more exciting and special.


WE NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE THE EUROPEAN PREMIERE OF RAPPORT AND NEW CREATION BY TOMI PAASONEN POSSIBLE. ANY DONATION, SMALL OR LARGE, WILL GET US CLOSER!
 

YANNIS ADONIOU, Director/Choreographer/Dancer

Since 1998 Yannis Adoniou he has been leading the critically acclaimed San Francisco-based dance company KUNST-STOFF bringing innovative works in the Bay Area and beyond . In 2010 he founded KUNST-STOFF arts, a studio/art space located in downtown San Francisco, designed to host performing and visual artists from around the globe. Adoniou has become a vital part of the Bay Area arts community by taking active roles as a curator, producer, and educator.

As a regular guest artist has toured across the USA and Europe. In addition to his work with KUNST-STOFF Dance Company, he has created works for companies  such as Seattle Opera, Sacramento Ballet, Bonn Ballet, the Modern Department at the University of Utah, West Bay Opera, West Edge Opera, and LINES Ballet/Dominican University, among others.

LINDSEY RENEE DERRY is a graduate of State University New York (SUNY) Purchase with a BFA in Dance Performance —summa cum laude— and a Certificate in Arts Management. In New York City she has worked with RIOULT (Pascal Rioult), Nai-Ni Chen Dance Company, and TAKE Dance (Takehiro Ueyama). For the past five years, Derry has spent several months out of the year working with José Navas/Compagnie Flak in Montréal. Now based in San Francisco, Derry is a Contributing Artist with Yannis Adoniou’s KUNST-STOFF Dance Company. In 2012 Derry launched L i n s d a n s to serve as the platform for her solo work.

KATIE GAYDOS grew up in Santa Monica, CA. In 2007 Katie moved to the Bay Area to attend UC Berkeley, where she received her BA in English Literature. Since relocating to San Francisco she has had the opportunity to train with Summer Lee Rhatigan at the San Francisco Conservatory of Dance and has performed works by Kara Davis, Daiane Lopes da Silva, Leyya Tawil and Yannis Adoniou. Katie has been working alongside Yannis Adoniou as a Contributing Artist with KUNST-STOFF Dance Company since Fall 2011.


CALVIN HILPERT was born in Florida and raised in Austin, Texas . He started dancing at age 12 with the Pittsburgh Ballet Theater School and shortly thereafter transferred to the San Francisco Ballet School. Calvin has performed with the Donlon Dance Company in Germany, and since 2012, has been a Contributing Artist with the KUNST-STOFF Dance Company, working with them locally in San Francisco, and on national and European commissions and tours.
story_txt:
WE NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE THE EUROPEAN PREMIERE OF RAPPORT AND NEW CREATION BY TOMI PAASONEN POSSIBLE.
Directed by Yannis Adoniou, KUNST-STOFF is a San Francisco based, Goldie award winning contemporary dance company that has been creating eclectic movement-focused art experiences in the Bay Area for the past 15 years. This summer, the company has been invited to bring their latest creation Rapport to Berlin. In addition, the KUNST-STOFF artists will have the opportunity to begin a new work with Berlin based choreographer Tomi Paasonen who co-founded the company with Yannis Adoniou in 1998. This new work will commemorate the company's 15th anniversary season and will premiere at ODC Theater this fall. This IndioGOGO campaign for $7,000 will go directly to support our flights and artistic fees.
Merging text and movement, Rapport exposes four artists as they dive beyond their performative lives. The European premiere at DOCK 11 will feature KUNST-STOFF Contributing Artists Yannis Adoniou, Katie Gaydos, Calvin Hilpert, and Lindsey Renee Derry.  Please take a moment to read about them below.
For twelve years now the KUNST-STOFF Dance Company has built a strong relationship with Dock 11, the premier venue for experimental performance in Berlin. Through this relationship we have built a creative bridge that now allows Bay Area artists to be exposed in Berlin. This year we are expanding our programming to include two packed weeks of workshops, residencies, and performances. While Dock 11 will support the majority of our theater production and promotion costs, we are required to find support for our travel expenses and artistic stipends during the tour.
Tomi Paasonen- choreographer, director and multimedia artist, based in Berlin and born in Helsinki, Finland- shares his time making pieces for KUNST-STOFF and directing stage art, creating choreographic structures, making video installations, interactive works, photography and teaching dance in Europe where he operates under the name PAA (Public Artistic Affairs). It has been several years since Tomi has been able to create a new group work for KUNST-STOFF, making this upcoming residency even more exciting and special. 
WE NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE THE EUROPEAN PREMIERE OF RAPPORT AND NEW CREATION BY TOMI PAASONEN POSSIBLE. ANY DONATION, SMALL OR LARGE, WILL GET US CLOSER!

 


YANNIS ADONIOU, Director/Choreographer/Dancer
Since 1998 Yannis Adoniou he has been leading the critically acclaimed San Francisco-based dance company KUNST-STOFF bringing innovative works in the Bay Area and beyond . In 2010 he founded KUNST-STOFF arts, a studio/art space located in downtown San Francisco, designed to host performing and visual artists from around the globe. Adoniou has become a vital part of the Bay Area arts community by taking active roles as a curator, producer, and educator.
As a regular guest artist has toured across the USA and Europe. In addition to his work with KUNST-STOFF Dance Company, he has created works for companies  such as Seattle Opera, Sacramento Ballet, Bonn Ballet, the Modern Department at the University of Utah, West Bay Opera, West Edge Opera, and LINES Ballet/Dominican University, among others.
LINDSEY RENEE DERRY is a graduate of State University New York (SUNY) Purchase with a BFA in Dance Performance —summa cum laude— and a Certificate in Arts Management. In New York City she has worked with RIOULT (Pascal Rioult), Nai-Ni Chen Dance Company, and TAKE Dance (Takehiro Ueyama). For the past five years, Derry has spent several months out of the year working with José Navas/Compagnie Flak in Montréal. Now based in San Francisco, Derry is a Contributing Artist with Yannis Adoniou’s KUNST-STOFF Dance Company. In 2012 Derry launched L i n s d a n s to serve as the platform for her solo work.
KATIE GAYDOS grew up in Santa Monica, CA. In 2007 Katie moved to the Bay Area to attend UC Berkeley, where she received her BA in English Literature. Since relocating to San Francisco she has had the opportunity to train with Summer Lee Rhatigan at the San Francisco Conservatory of Dance and has performed works by Kara Davis, Daiane Lopes da Silva, Leyya Tawil and Yannis Adoniou. Katie has been working alongside Yannis Adoniou as a Contributing Artist with KUNST-STOFF Dance Company since Fall 2011.
CALVIN HILPERT was born in Florida and raised in Austin, Texas . He started dancing at age 12 with the Pittsburgh Ballet Theater School and shortly thereafter transferred to the San Francisco Ballet School. Calvin has performed with the Donlon Dance Company in Germany, and since 2012, has been a Contributing Artist with the KUNST-STOFF Dance Company, working with them locally in San Francisco, and on national and European commissions and tours.
